Dear Mr. Ziomkowski:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
January 29, 2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the
contract and ISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your
contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Claudia Triestram, at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
One of one new hire employee file reviewed lacked a written evaluation within 180
days of hire.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
The facility serves a refugee population that is not under the ISEP monitoring
regulations.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
The facility does not have a contract with DHHS that is regulated by DCWL. They
have a contract regulated through the Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR).
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance during this period under review.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation during this period under review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
1

The facility is in compliance with the corrective action plan that they established in
response to the situation of child abuse and/or neglect. The facility established a plan
that prohibited staff from other programs to pick up shifts at Bellaview unless the
program supervisor of both programs approved, prohibited staff from taking residents
on community outings by themselves, and increased trainings for new and
experienced staff regarding personal boundaries.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period in response to 2019 Renewal Inspection.
Compliance was achieved in all areas.
A tour of the facility occurred during the unannounced inspection completed on
January 29, 2020. The facility was clean and in good repair. The resident’s bedrooms
and bathrooms were orderly. During interviews with staff they reported being overall
happy and well supported in their program. The residents reported they feel safe and
secure at the facility and enjoy the school and community outings. There were no
concerns regarding the supervision or availability of staff including the therapist and
case manager.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on their
regular license.
